intro: Chamaecladon rubescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed chamaecladon, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its stems are reddish in color, which becomes more pronounced as the plant matures. Chamaecladon rubescens is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
